page.title: 10CASTLETOWN - DOMESTIC POWER
page.content: The main power source for domestic use is electricity from the National Grid.As well as power from hydro schemes and coal powered stations,power is fed into the National Grid from Dounreay Nuclear Power Station which is the major employer in the area. Most houses have chimneys and use open fires which burn coal,wood and peat.Many families in landward areas have peat banks where peat is cut during the summer months for use in the winter.There are two peat extracting companies in Caithness which provide peat for domestic use . Bottled gas is used by some ,mainly for cooking ,as there is no piped gas supply. Alternative power sources are not in evidence apart from a windmill,built in 1982 at a cost of Â£40 000 ,which provides power for one house.
